section.name: Introduction to Rotamer Optimization Using Many-Body Dead-End Elimination
section.p: Discrete rotamer libraries of optimal side-chain conformations have been developed to find the global minimum energy conformation of a protein. However, implementation of rotamer libraries using brute force is computationally expensive, as there exists large number of permutations. Through rigorous inequalities eliminating high-energy rotamers, rotamer pairs, and rotamer trimers, the Dead-End Elimination (DEE) algorithm eliminates many permutations, finding optimal side-chain positions in a reasonable amount of time.

section.name: Application to Mutation S163R in C1QTN5
section.p: The following example demonstrates global optimization with mutation S163R in C1QTN5 (PDB 4F3J). The general protocol is as follows:

ol.li: Refine/optimize the wild-type model using all-versus-all global optimization. If the protein is large, use the sliding window method.
Perform a local optimization around the mutated region using a distance cutoff.

subsection.name: Using DEE to Globally Optimize the Wild-Type PDB File
subsection.p: To perform an all-versus-all global optimization using DEE for all residues, use the following command: ffxc rotamer -a 2 -c A -l 1 -x 1 -g false 4F3J.pdb
The resulting PDB file is automatically saved as 4F3J.pdb_2. Rename the PDB file 4F3J_rotOpt.pdb to remove the "_2" from the extension.

subsection.name: Mutating Residue 163 from Serine to Arginine
subsection.p: To mutate residue 163 in chain A from serine to arginine, use the following command: ffxc mutatePDB -c A -n ARG -r 163 4F3J_rotOpt.pdb
The PDB file with the mutation is saved as 4F3J_rotOpt.pdb_2. Rename the pdb file 4F3J_rotOpt_S163R.pdb to remove the "_2" from the extension.

subsection.name: Using DEE to Optimize the Mutated Region
subsection.p: To perform an all-versus-all global optimization using DEE for all residues, use the following command: ffxc rotamer -a 2 -c A -l 1 -x 1 -g false 4F3J_rotOpt_S163R.pdb
To perform a global optimization using DEE within the residue range 130-190, use the following command: ffxc rotamer -a 2 -c A -s 130 -f 190 -g false -l 1 4F3J_rotOpt_S163R.pdb

To perform a global optimization using DEE within a distance cutoff of 9 Angstroms from mutated residue 163, use the following command: ffxc rotamer -a 4 -c A -l 1 -s 163 -f 163 -w 1 -r 9.0 -g false 4F3J_rotOpt_S163R.pdb
